mention.text: the French oceanographer Jacques-Yves Cousteau said

scientists there have measured the Earth 's thinning ozone layer , letting through radiation that risks catastrophic changes in world climate and ocean levels A New Zealand team recently reported the ozone hole over Antarctica was much more serious than previously believed Cousteau warns that jostling the precarious balance invites calamity For example , just scraping the surface of the Earth spreads dust that alters reflectivity , raising temperatures and melting ice Human activity
